Morality.Name: Bravery
Morality.Description:
[H4]Bravery (Strength)[h4]
The characters bravery is quite remarkable. Whether facing down a charging rancor or racing into a burning building to save innocents, he is always willing to take risks to help others.

Morality.Name: Love
Morality.Description:
[H4]Love (Strength)[h4]
The character has an open heart. While he may hold a special place in his heart for his companions or a significant other, he tends to genuinely like most individuals he meets. His love for others can make him charming and affable, and exceedingly tolerant.

Morality.Name: Caution
Morality.Description:
[H4]Caution (Strength)[h4]
The character possesses commendable prudence, willing to always look before he leaps into a new situation. His forward-thinking ways may have saved his fellows from dangerous situations on numerous occasions.

Morality.Name: Enthusiasm
Morality.Description:
[H4]Enthusiasm (Strength)[h4]
The character is always ready to try something new, and he approaches all of his tasks, even mundane ones, with excitement. He's not one to overthink a situation, lest he miss a great new opportunity.

Morality.Name: Compassion
Morality.Description:
[H4]Compassion (Strength)[h4]
The character cares about the tribulations others face, and wants to help those he comes across. His compassion may lead to self-sacrifice in order to aid those who need it.

Morality.Name: Mercy
Morality.Description:
[H4]Mercy (Strength)[h4]
The character shows mercy toward his foes, dealing with them fairly and honorably. He can spare the defenseless, will help a helpless enemy, and generally does not abuse a position of strength.

Morality.Name: Curiosity
Morality.Description:
[H4]Curiosity (Strength)[h4]
The character is driven to learn new things, to seek out and discover new information, and to expand his knowledge and understanding of those things that interest him.

Morality.Name: Pride
Morality.Description:
[H4]Pride (Strength)[h4]
Pride can be a powerful emotion, and can push a character to impressive feats of personal accomplishment. He strives to be the best and to lake pleasure in his skills.

Morality.Name: Independence
Morality.Description:
[H4]Independence (Strength)[h4]
The character believes in relying on himself. He does not count on others to perform tasks for him, instead, he ensures he can handle any situation he encounters. He refuses to be a burden on others.

Morality.Name: Ambition
Morality.Description:
[H4]Ambition (Strength)[h4]
An ambitious character sets a lofty goal for himself and then strives to accomplish it. The harder the task, the more willing the character is to take it on, and the greater the triumph when he finally succeeds.

Morality.Name: Justice
Morality.Description:
[H4]Justice (Strength)[h4]
The character strives for just and deliberate actions in his life, and in his interactions with others. He attempts to make the objectively right choice every time, knowing that justice is more likely to guarantee positive outcomes than sympathy or other emotional displays.

Morality.Name: Discipline
Morality.Description:
[H4]Discipline (Strength)[h4]
Rigorous mental and physical discipline comes naturally to the character. He does not make choices rashly, and every action is precise and selected. Those who think they can goad the character into making foolish choices are sorely mistaken.

Morality.Name: Anger
Morality.Description:
[H4]Anger (Weakness)[h4]
Hot blood, however, can easily lead to hot tempers. The character is quick to anger, and what he cannot deal with face-to-face can often frustrate him to the point of rage.

Morality.Name: Jealousy
Morality.Description:
[H4]Jealousy (Weakness)[h4]
Love, if not given selflessly, can quickly turn to jealousy. The character's personality Lends toward envy if his love is not reciprocated, or sometimes he simply envies others' accomplishments or possessions.

Morality.Name: Fear
Morality.Description:
[H4]Fear (Weakness)[h4]
The line between caution and fear is a thin one. Sometimes the character spends too much time concerned about the potential problems of a situation to act in that situation at all. At other times, his caution causes him to flee when danger presents itself, through bolder action might reap real rewards.

Morality.Name: Recklessness
Morality.Description:
[H4]Recklessness (Weakness)[h4]
Of course, a little thought can go a long way towards saving someone from a major mistake, which this character may find out to his sorrow on more than one occasion. Reckless behavior can leave him in dangerous situations or at the mercy of more calculating individuals.

Morality.Name: Hatred
Morality.Description:
[H4]Hatred (Weakness)[h4]
The galaxy can be a cruel and heartless place, compassion can quickly turn to hatred of the individuals or situations that, cause others to suffer. When a character's mind rolls with simmering hatred, that hatred may be all too slow to fade.

Morality.Name: Weakness
Morality.Description:
[H4]Weakness (Weakness)[h4]
There is a fine line between showing mercy to one's foes and letting evil fester because one does not want to engage with it. The character may let bad things happen simply because it is too hard to deal with them.

Morality.Name: Obsession
Morality.Description:
[H4]Obsession (Weakness)[h4]
Sometimes, interest in something can turn to obsession if not tempered with reason. The character can slip into an obsessive state about his need to discover information, accomplish a goal, or even defeat a rival, and he may ignore all else until success is his.

Morality.Name: Arrogance
Morality.Description:
[H4]Arrogance (Weakness)[h4]
Pride, among all emotions, is perhaps the easiest to fall to a darker form. Arrogance mirrors pride, but satisfaction in one's accomplishments is replaced with contempt for others failings. It is not enough to succeed: the character also expects all others to fail.

Morality.Name: Coldness
Morality.Description:
[H4]Coldness (Weakness)[h4]
Self-reliance can slip into isolation if one is not careful. A cold character doesn't just desire to rely only on himself, but has nothing but disinterest for anyone else If they can't help themselves, why should he aid them?

Morality.Name: Greed
Morality.Description:
[H4]Greed (Weakness)[h4]
An ambitious character is only as selfless as his goals. Those who strive For worldly pleasures, whether power, wealth, or personal comforts, can quickly find their ambition turning to simple greed.

Morality.Name: Cruelty
Morality.Description:
[H4]Cruelty (Weakness)[h4]
All too often, the cruel use justice to excuse their actions. If one stops himself from tempering justice with empathy and understanding, he can inflict great harm on others and feel justified doing it. Eventually, he can grow to revel in the suffering of others, even as he deludes himself Into thinking he makes the "just" choice.

Morality.Name: Obstinance
Morality.Description:
[H4]Obstinance (Weakness)[h4]
Disciplined characters may fall into the trap of simple stubbornness if they are not careful. An obstinate character often refuses to consider any course of action other than the one he chooses, unwilling to accept that someone else may have conceived of a better option.

Morality.Name: Intolerance
Morality.Description: [H4]Intolerance (Weakness)[h4] [P]A strict adherence to the rules means that the character is unwilling to adapt even when extenuating circumstances should provide an exception. His code keeps him from pursuing his own desires, and perhaps even what he belies is just.

Morality.Name: Naïveté
Morality.Description: [H4]Naïveté (Weakness)[h4] [P]Cunning foes take advantage of the characters generosity, trying his patience as they try to get away with as much as they can. The PC's inability to identify false contrition sometimes lets crafty villains off the hook.

Morality.Name: Impatience
Morality.Description: [H4]Impatience (Weakness)[h4] [P]The many great things that the character wants to achieve are not all possible in one lifetime, so the character sometimes makes compromises in order to achieve more. His need for immediate achievement might even prove self-destructive, interfering with his long-term goals.

Morality.Name: Consistency
Morality.Description: [H4]Consistency (Strength)[h4] [P]he character can be counted on to do the things the same way every time. Whether its a morning cup of caf or a routine security scan, he is punctual and dependable, and strange circumstances or bad luck do not weaken his commitment.

Morality.Name: Dedication
Morality.Description: [H4]Dedication (Strength)[h4] [P]The character does not do things halfway. He takes every responsibility to its end and he commits his full power to everything he does.

Morality.Name: Indecision
Morality.Description: [H4]Indecision (Weakness)[h4] [P]The desire to be ready for anything means that the character's preparations are cumbersome. When faced with unknowns, he may become paralyzed with uncertainty at all the possibilities he must account for.

Morality.Name: Dogmatic
Morality.Description: [H4]Dogmatic (Weakness)[h4] When pressed or emotionally burned out, this character falls back on rigid edicts instead of context. It takes emotional energy to grasp all points of view, and sometimes there isn't time.

Morality.Name: Vanity
Morality.Description: [H4]Vanity (Weakness)[h4] The character turns self-deference into false modesty, denigrating himself and expecting others to bolster his ego. A twisted passive-aggressiveness can emerge in which the character demends recognition for this modesty.

Morality.Name: Guardedness
Morality.Description: [H4]Guardedness (Weakness)[h4] The character has been betrayed one too many times and refuses to allow it to happen again. Why expect better of a person when there is no reward for doing so?

Morality.Name: Weariness
Morality.Description: [H4]Weariness (Weakness)[h4] Even a saint can burn out. It's not that people don't deserve help or a second chance. It's that there is always another. And another. And another. Soon this tide becomes faceless, and even suffering becomes abstract.

Morality.Name: Spite
Morality.Description: [H4]Spite (Weakness)[h4] The character deliberately tries to upset or hurt those beneath him. Indulgence in this pettieness comes easily as these individuals deserve contempt.

Morality.Name: Empathy
Morality.Description: [H4]Empathy (Strength)[h4] The character easily understands and even feels the emotions of those nearby, even then they are guarding their true feelings. Knowing how their actions affect others the character is careful to treat others with kindness and dignity.

Morality.Name: Condemnation
Morality.Description: [H4]Condemnation (Weakness)[h4] The character inisists on a standard that no one can bear. This includes the condemnation of the self, punishing oneself for transgressions imagined or actual.

Morality.Name: Alienation
Morality.Description: [H4]Alienation (Weakness)[h4] With too many people and too many problems, the character gets overwhelmed and withdraws. The city continues on, ignoring any one person. Why not let time take care of the problem?

Morality.Name: Closed-mindedness
Morality.Description: [H4]Closed-mindedness (Weakness)[h4] Studious discipline, however, can bring about intolerance and disregard for outside input. When deciding a course of action, the character often refuses any outside ideas that might deviate from firm internal viewpoints.

Morality.Name: Assertiveness
Morality.Description: [H4]Assertiveness (Strength)[h4] In all things, the character is quite determined and steadfast. No matter the situation, the PC shows no hint of idleness or weakness in speeh or action, only firm conviction.

Morality.Name: Defiance
Morality.Description: [H4]Defiance (Weakness)[h4] The character mistakes defiance for bravery. This merely serves to cause tension and trouble for others, while generating a false sense of personal satisfaction.

Morality.Name: Cold-Heartedness
Morality.Description: [H4]Cold-heartedness (Weakness)[h4] The drive needed to reach these goals can make the character set aside any concepts of compassion. Only the PC's own personal goals matter, with little care if any others are broken and cast aside as he rises.

Morality.Name: Obstinacy
Morality.Description: [H4]Obstinacy (Weakness)[h4] Firm convictions can mask an excessively stubborn nature that pushes aside any hesitation about or reflection upon a desired goal. The PC's mind never changes once committed even in light of contradictory evidence.

Morality.Name: Disdain
Morality.Description: [H4]Disdain (Weakness)[h4] Pride in one's self turns dark, and the character views others with utter contempt and scorn. None are worthy of the PC's company, they seem to exist only stand in the way.

Morality.Name: Disarray
Morality.Description: [H4]Disarray (Weakness)[h4] In a rush of enthusiastic energy, there is little attempt to truly appreciate or master any one item. The character is easily diverted whenever a new attraction appears, often leaving tasks incomplete or threats unresolved.

Morality.Name: Vengeance
Morality.Description: [H4]Vengeance (Weakness)[h4] Caring overly for others, especially victims, can lead the character to desire revenge against those who made them suffer. Only when such targets are tracked down and brought low can balance be restored.

Morality.Name: Frugality
Morality.Description: [H4]Frugality (Strength)[h4] There is strength inliving a simple life, not just in eschewing possessions but also in keeping relationships simple, so as not to be distracted from the bigger picture.

Morality.Name: Wonder
Morality.Description: [H4]Wonder (Strength)[h4] In a city, every day provides a new adventure. This keeps the character connected, always learning, and alive. The city teaches the character to remain open to new experiences as it surprises daily.

Morality.Name: Righteousness
Morality.Description: [H4]Righteousness (Strength)[h4] The character takes anger and instead of suppressing it, uses it to fuel work. Pushing harder allows him to advocate for those who can't do so for themselves.

Morality.Name: Trust
Morality.Description: [H4]Trust (Strength)[h4] This character believes in giving everyone the benefit of the doubt. The good that comes from trusting others builds communities and provides emotional support.

Morality.Name: Modesty
Morality.Description: [H4]Modesty (Strength)[h4] The character eschews credit and thanks. After all, anyone can do this work. This attitude ensures discpline and focus to the task at hand and thus helping others and reducing suffering.

Morality.Name: Malleability
Morality.Description: [H4]Malleability (Strength)[h4] This character is morally and ethically flexible and judges situations and others based on reletive circumstance for the good of the community rather than on a strict legal code.

Morality.Name: Mercilessness
Morality.Description: [H4]Mercilessness (Weakness)[h4] The quest for justice can turn the character away from concepts of pity or remorse. The PC is concerned only with laws or a personal code, no matter the situation or mitigating factors.
